intro: Prunella vulgaris var. intermedia, commonly known as the common selfheal, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with toothed margins and produces spikes of violet-blue flowers from June to August. It thrives in moist, sunny to partially shaded environments, often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. The species is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its healing benefits.
